alert.note: Alert for Alamance; Guilford; Randolph (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 3:26PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Alamance, northeastern Randolph and eastern Guilford Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 325 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Randleman, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greensboro, Burlington, Graham, Randleman, McLeansville, Elon, Gibsonville, Pleasant Garden, Swepsonville and Alamance. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
